IMAP Mail Server Server name: outlook.office365.com Port 993 Connection security: SSL/TTS Authentication method: OAuth2

SMTP Server Description: Office 365 (Microsoft) Server name: smtp.office365.com Port: 587 Connection security: STARTTLS Authentication method: OAuth2

I am hoping there is a way to search other email header fields such as Reply-to, Received, Return-Path, and Message-Id. Maybe others as well.

Currently running Thunderbird 115.3.1.

Thanks!

I've been using this code since the Netscape mail client days and I rarely slow down to reach for the mouse. I've been using it so long my hands just move without me thinking about it, and there's a number of changes that I have to adjust to. This one though is the most difficult to deal with.

title: Sending email
content:
After updating to the most recent version of Thunderbird, I cannot send email using my address of billward@kc.rr.com. I can send email using my address of billward122@gmail.com. When I click Send, I get this message: "Send message error. Sending of the message failed. An error occurred while sending mail. The mail server responded: billward@kc.rr.com sender rejected. The email address you are sending as must match the email address you used to auth. Please check your SMTP settings. AUP#Out-1500. Please verify that your email address is correct in your account settings and try again."

All my account settings, including my email address, are the same as they have always been. The problem with not being able to send emails only started a few days ago. I suspect it is related to the latest automatic update to version 115.4.1(32 bit) or to updates just before this one.

How can I get Thunderbird to let me send emails again the address of billward@kc.rr.com? Thank you.

title: Calendar not working properly
content:
Hello,

I checked the Help website and couldn't find my specific calendar issue.

After the latest update my Thunderbird calendar no longer seems to work properly. I'm using Thunderbird 115.4.1 64bit on Windows 11 64bit. I have checked for updates for Thunderbird, Windows, and any add-ons. All appear to be up to date.

While some appointments are there, others aren't. I checked my calendar website and it looks correct there and all my appointments are there. Also, all my appointments are showing/correct on my phone as well. It's just in Thunderbird that things aren't correct.

I can add and delete appointments without any issues, but if I add an appointment that was listed previously but no longer showing in Thunderbird, it shows up twice on my phone and the calendar website.

It doesn't seem to matter the method used to add the previous (or new) appointments as there's a mixture of appointments showing that have been added using different methods/platforms (i.e. phone, website, or Thunderbird).

I do use the Owl add-on, but I emailed them several days ago and I haven't received a reply so I thought maybe they didn't consider it to be an Owl issue so have just ignored it. Also, I use Owl for my emails as well and they're working properly.

Any help you could provide would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,

Steve
creator: trektek

title: Freeze Favorites in the Inbox Left Pane
content: I would love to see option to freeze the Favourites section of the folder pane to the top of the folder. Currently if you scroll down the folder pane the Favourites section disappears. If you have lots of folders, this defeats the purpose of having it. I've tried searching for solutions many times and tried add-ons but to no avail. This is the most frustrating and time wasting function of Thunderbird for me and I've seen other users in previous conversations express the same concern. It is a standard feature and has been for many years in Outlook. Please include this in future releases!

title: Newest Thunderbird version doesn't work with my internet provider
content: In August I stopped being able to send out emails through Thunderbird, but I still was getting incoming mail. My family are all computer nerds but they couldn't figure it out. I talked to the Spectrum Help and they figured out what changes to make in the Thunderbird settings for port numbers to make the new version work, but there was one last change they couldn't manage. They figured out that there needs to be a place in the Thunderbird settings to put in my Spectrum password, for incoming mail. There is one for outgoing mail (the choices were to put in the password or to click on "not necessary", and I used "not necessary") but there is no choice for incoming mail. With the changes they made, I can no longer get incoming or outgoing mail, so I have had to use the Spectrum website to manage the email and it is absolutely horrible, limited, disorganized and very, very slow. I desperately need to fix this. I need to talk to someone in real time, but I can't find a phone number on your website. Please send me a phone number I can call, or you call me at [phone# removed from public support forum]. Thanks.

title: Outgoing email has stopped since Thunderbird update
content:
Outgoing smtp from Thunderbird has stopped since update. I have reviewed all the documentation and been in contact with my provider and still have been unable to resolve the problem. I am very frustrated with this issue. I attempted the SSL/TLS reversion back to version 1 and this did not help.

I have tried changing the port number to that suggested my my provider which for outgoing is supposed to be 587, although 24 has always worked. They also suggested changing the server name to mail.twc.com which did not work. They suggested the full email in the User Name field, which I did with various combinations of port numbers and server names and none have worked.

When I attempt to send I get the following error: The message could not be sent because connecting to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtp-server.rochester.rr.com failed. The server may be unavailable or is refusing SMTP connections. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again.

When I use changed settings as described above I just get a timed out error as though there is no connection at all.

Screenshot of SMTP settings as they have always been attached. Email provider rochester.rr.com. ISP Spectrum. No firewall. Virus protection Bitdefender v. 27.0.23.112. OS Windows 11 Home build 22621.2428. Thunderbird version 115.4.1

Please assist

title: Double-clicking the T-Bird Inbox icon does not refresh the Inbox, but restarting the T-Bird app does.
content:
Hello,

I just did a fresh install of the latest version (115.4.1 64-bit) of Thunderbird on my Win10-64bit system. I have over 1TB of SSD memory available on my Intel i7-12700K DDR5 system and no other significant applications are running. When I sent an email to an account I had set up on it, I at first thought T-Bird was simply slow to receive emails because it was taking over a minute to get them. During that time I repeatedly double-clicked the Inbox item in the account tree to try to get it to refresh but it didn't seem to matter. However, I finally tried simply restarting T-Bird immediately after sending the email and to my surprise the email was available in the Inbox immediately. I cleared the cache and tried running in the troubleshooting mode but it didn't matter. Am I misunderstanding how to refresh the Inbox or is there some different way to do it in the newest T-Bird version?

Thank you in advance :-) Ray
creator: RayMitchell1

creator: martin376

title: Mails received have the received date as when I opened Thunderbird
content:
I have a camera setup that sends an email when motion is detected. The mail headers have a received field with a datetime corresponding (roughly) to the moment the detection occurred (as UTC+0). When I open Thunderbird it will show all the mails via IMAP with "Date" and "Received" as the moment Thunderbird will fetch them, not the actual received date. Thunderbird will remember these dates. Since all the dates are the same, it makes it impossible to order the mails by date received. Ordering the mails by subject is not 100% correct as the dates in the subject are not YYYYMMDD formatted (as UTC+2).

I'm using Thunderbird 115.3.2 on Arch Linux (x86_64). This issue was also present in 102, I'm not sure of 91, as I held off for Supernova before making this report.

Please see the attached images for clarification.
creator: InFerYes

title: Opened a number of emails and left them open. Now when I return to them they are blank
content: Prior to the new Supernova version of Thunderbird being launched, I had opened a number of emails and left them open. Now when I return to them they are blank. I can read newly opened emails that I left open, but not the old ones. Is there any way I can read the emails that I had left open prior to Supernova?
creator: rumiandme153

title: Why does Thunderbird "misidentify" Forum Senders when redo profile email account?
content:
I recently created a new profile for thunderbird. I have had multiple problems with this new version 115.3.1 (32-bit). Very frustrated.

I am using a gmail account and thunderbird as client. When I recreated IMAP account to new profile, it makes EVERY correspondent the same person. I use the account for forum emails from an organization where like professionals share information and it is private. The new profile takes the name of one member and puts that in all prior emails, rather then having the correct sender name. I had no problem with my prior profile and cant figure out why Thunderbird is doing this?? I a different email account it did the same thing with a different organization and it put same correspondent name on most, but not all group emails.

I am guessing its how thunderbird is reading the message source code. Shouldn't it be taking it from the "FROM" tag in it.

I appreciate any suggestions or comments. I still have my old profile and can use that with no problem. Also gmail online email stuff is fine, so it has to be Thunderbird that is deciding to input one correspondent's name for forum email. I don't understand why or how to fix.

Thank you

Matthew
creator: MSKHawaii
